definition[0]: a reduction in activity or speed
example[0]: a slowdown in the US economy
definition[1]: a period when people deliberately work slowly in order to protest about something
example[1]: Thereâ€™s been a slowdown in domestic demand for automobiles.
example[2]: A spokesman blamed heavy competition and the international economic slowdown for the job losses.
definition[3]: a period of time when people deliberately work slowly in order to protest about something
example[3]: The unions already have a work slowdown under way.
